data.Sentence_cn: 早饭后，我送孩子们上学，然后就去了商店。
data.Sentence: After breakfast, I sent the children to school and then I went to the shops.
It was still early when I returned home.

data.Sentence_cn: 孩子们在上学，我丈夫在上班，家里清静得很。
data.Sentence: The children were at school, my husband was at work and the house was quiet.

data.Sentence_cn: 于是我决定做些肉馅饼。
data.Sentence: So I decided to make some meat pies.

data.Sentence_cn: 不一会儿我就忙着调拌起了黄油和面粉，很快我的手上就沾满了粘粘的面糊。
data.Sentence: In a short time I was busy mixing butter and flour and my hands were soon covered with sticky pastry.

data.Sentence_cn: 恰恰在此时，电话铃响了。
data.Sentence: At exactly that moment, the telephone rang.

data.Sentence_cn: 没有什么能比这更烦人了。
data.Sentence: Nothing could have been more annoying.

data.Sentence_cn: 我用两个沾满面糊的手指捏起了话筒。当听出是海伦.贝茨的声音时，非常丧气。
data.Sentence: I picked up the receiver between two sticky fingers and was dismayed when I recognized the voice of Helen Bates.

data.Sentence_cn: 我用了10分钟的时间才说服她过会儿再来电话。
data.Sentence: It took me ten minutes to persuade her to ring back later.
At last I hung up the receiver.

data.Sentence_cn: 真是糟糕透了！我的手指上、电话机上以及门的把手上，都沾上了面糊。
data.Sentence: What a mess! There was pastry on my fingers, on the telephone, and on the doorknobs.

data.Sentence_cn: 我刚回到厨房，门铃又响了起来，响声足以把死人唤醒。
data.Sentence: I had no sooner got back to the kitchen than the doorbell rang loud enough to wake the dead.

data.Sentence_cn: 这次是邮递员，他要我签收一封挂号信！
data.Sentence: This time it was the postman and he wanted me to sign for a registered letter!
